alert.note: Alert for New Madrid; Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 12:43PM CST until March 07 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River Above Tiptonville. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 39.0 feet, In Tennessee, water begins to go over Tiptonville Ferry Road, Barr Road, and the farm land east of the Tiptonville Ferry Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 37.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Tuesday was 37.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 38.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
